isis.stitle: AIR CONDITIONING - HEATER SYSTEM: 2000, 4000, AND 8000 - 12/06/1994 and After - REMOVE AND INSTALL - EXPANSION VALVE

step1.para: Remove refrigerant. Refer to GROUP 16 - AIR CONDITIONING BASIC THEORY, SYSTEM DIAGNOSIS AND SERVICE with R-134a in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for information on recovering refrigerant from the system.
Remove the 10 mm nut from the center of the expansion valve ( Figure 23) and pull the plate both A/C lines are attached to away from the expansion valve. Remove and discard O-rings.

figure.caption: Figure 23. Remove Nut From Center of Expansion Valve

step1.para: Remove two (2) 5/32 inch Allen head capscrews that fasten the expansion valve to the evaporator ( Figure 24).
Disconnect the electrical connector from the high pressure cut-off switch ( Figure 24) and remove the expansion valve.
If the expansion valve or high pressure cut-off switch is to be replaced, remove the high pressure cut-off switch from the valve.
Before installing the expansion valve, lubricate new O-rings with mineral oil.
Install the O-rings on the evaporator fittings that protrude through the dash panel seal ( Figure 25).

figure.caption: Figure 25. Install O-Rings on Evaporator Fittings

step1.para: Install the expansion valve with the stud side facing out ( Figure 24) and secure in place with two (2) 5/32 inch Allen head capscrews removed in Step 3 of EXPANSION VALVE, Remove. Tighten to 79 to 89 in-lbs. (8.9 to 10 N•m).

Install new O-rings on the ends of both lines that will be installed on the expansion valve. Slide the plate that holds both lines into place on the stud. Install the 10 mm lock nut and tighten it to 80 to 90 in-lbs. (9 to 10 N•m).

caution.para: Do not over-tighten the 10 mm lock nut. Too much torque will strip the threads on the stud, which will require replacing the expansion valve.

step1.para: Install high pressure cut-off switch ( Figure 24).
Plug the electrical connector into the high pressure cut-off switch.

Recharge A/C system with R-134a refrigerant. Refer to GROUP 16-AIR CONDITIONING BASIC THEORY, SYSTEM DIAGNOSIS AND SERVICE with R-134a in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for information on recharging the system with R-134a refrigerant.
